metadata.comments: This playbook uses the PaloAlto connector to take necessary actions on URL address like Block URL/Unblock URL from predefined address group and also gives an option to close the incident.
metadata.title: PaloAlto-PAN-OS-BlockURL
metadata.description: This playbook allows blocking/unblocking URLs in PaloAlto, using **predefined address group**. This allows to make changes on predefined address group, which is attached to security policy rule.
prerequisites:
1. PaloAlto connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the connector doc page. 

 2. Generate an API key.[Refer this link on how to generate the API Key](https://paloaltolactest.trafficmanager.net/restapi-doc/#tag/key-generation) 

 3. Address group should be created for PAN-OS and this should be used while creating playbooks.
postDeployment:
**a. Authorize connections** 

 Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 6. Repeat steps for other connection such as Teams connection and PAN-OS API connection (For authorizing the PAN-OS API connection, API Key needs to be provided) 

 **b. Configurations in Sentinel** 

 1. In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with risky URL 

 2. Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

metadata.description: Enter value for Teams Group Id
Enter value for Teams channel Id
Name of the custom connector, if you want to change the default name, make sure to use the same in all Paloalto automation playbooks as well

Compose_product_name.description: compose to select the incident alert product name

body.message:
PAN-OS Playbook ran and performed the following actions:
@{variables('URLAddressAction')}



Actions taken on Sentinel : Add comment to incident and closure with classification reason  @{body('Post_an_Adaptive_Card_to_a_Teams_channel_and_wait_for_a_response')['data']?['incidentStatus']}

Condition_based_on_the_incident_configur.description: This decides the action taken on the summarized adaptive card

Create_an_address_object.description: This creates a new address object for the malicious URL

equals: Block URL ( add to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')} address group )

Condition__to_check_if_user_chosen_Block.description: This check if user chooses Block URL

inputs.name: URLAddressAction
inputs.value:
URL Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']} ,  Action Taken :  Blocked  by               
                       adding to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}  ,  Status  :  Success

Append_success_status_Blocked_URL_status.description: append action taken to summarize on the adaptive card

inputs.name: URLAddressAction
inputs.value:
URL Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']} ,  Action Taken :  UnBlocked  by               
                       adding to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}  ,  Status  :  Success

Append_success_status_UnBlocked_URL_stat.description: append action taken to summarize on the adaptive card

equals: Block URL ( add to @{outputs('Configured_address_group')} address group )

inputs.name: URLAddressAction
inputs.value: URL Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']}  ,  Action Taken :  @{body('Post_an_Adaptive_Card_to_a_Teams_channel_and_wait_for_a_response_3')['submitActionId']} ,  Status :  Failure

Append_failure_status_to_summary_card.description: append action taken to summarize on the adaptive card

inputs.name: URLAddressAction
inputs.value: URL Address : @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']},  Action Taken :  @{body('Post_an_Adaptive_Card_to_a_Teams_channel_and_wait_for_a_response_3')['submitActionId']} ,  Status :  Success

Append_to_array_variable_URL_address_act.description: This appends the action taken on URL to the list of existing actions

Condition_based_on_user_inputs_from_the_.description: condition to check the submit action is block / unblock or Ignore

value.text: The URL @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']}  is already a member of the blocked address group @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}

Append_address_group_text.description: append address group text to adaptive card dynamically

Filter_array_URL_address_from_the_list_o.description: This filters the URL address from predefined address group to unreference/unblock URL

Set_dynamic_action_name.description: variable to set action name dynamically

unreference_URL_address_from_the_existin.description: unreference URL address from the group members and update

Append_URL_address_to_the_address_group_.description: append URL address to the address group members

value.text: The URL @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']}  is not a member of the blocked address group @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}

Append_address_group_text_to_adaptive_ca.description: append address group text to adaptive card dynamically

Condition_to_check_if_URL_already_presen.description: condition to check the malicious URL address is present in the predefined address group and the URL is part of static member

Append_URL_to_array_of_address_group_mem.description: append the Malicious URL address to the existing group members to block / unblock from the predefined address group

value.text: The URL @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']}  is not a member of the blocked address group @{outputs('Configured_address_group')}

Append_to_array_variable_text_if_URL_is_.description: This appends the text to display If URL is not a member of security policy rules

Set_variable_to_Block_URL.description: This sets the variable block URL

Condition_to_check_if_URL_address_alread.description: This checks if URL is a member of any of the list of address objects

value.text: It is also member of the following security policy rules

Append_policy_text.description: dynamic policy text based on security policies

Append_security_policies.description: append security policies which the URL address is exist

value.text: It is not a member of any other Policy Rules

Append_policy_text_to_adaptive_card_body.description: dynamic policy text based on security policies

Append_security_policies_to_adaptive_car.description: append security policies which the URL address is exist

Condition_to_check_if_the_URL_is_a_part_.description: condition to check if the URL address is present in the existing security policy rules to conditionally apply the policy text and security policy rules

Filter_array_URL_from_list_of_security_r.description: This filters all the security rules in which this URL is a member

Filter_array_of_URL_address_from_list_of.description: This filters the list of address objects in which this URL is a member

List_address_groups.description: This gets complete list of address object groups present in the PAN-OS

Select_security_policy_rules.description: prepare columns list to show the security policy rules in the adaptive card if URL address is present

value.text: Possible Comprised URL @{items('For_each_malicious_URL')?['Url']} detected by the provider : @{outputs('Compose_product_name')}

Set_variable_adaptive_card_body.description: variable to hold adaptive card body

Set_variable_address_group_members.description: assign list of address group members

Initialize_variable_URL_address_action.description: This holds the action taken on each URL

Initialize_variable_action_name.description: variable to store action name to be displayed on adaptive card

Initialize_variable_adaptive_card_body.description: variable to store adaptive card body json

Initialize_variable_address_group_member.description: variable to store the list of address group members

List_address_objects.description: This gets complete list of address object present in the PAN-OS

List_security_rules.description: This gets complete list of security policy rules present in the PAN-OS

Select_alert_product_names.description: data operator to select the alert product name

Set_variable_actions_on_URL_to_be_displa.description: This is used to compose the list of actions taken by SOC on respective URL addresses
